note:
Name:  ___                   Unit No:   ___
 
Admission Date:  ___              Discharge Date:   ___
 
Date of Birth:  ___             Sex:   F
 
Service: MEDICINE
 
Allergies: 
Pencillin / Sulfa
 
Attending: ___.
 
Chief Complaint:
Fever, neck pain
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
None

 
History of Present Illness:
Ms. ___ is an ___ year old woman w/ PMH DVT w/ IVC filter,
paroxysmal atrial fibrillation, Grave's disease s/p radioactive
iodine ablation, hypothyroidism, C diff colitis who presented as
a transfer from ___ after a fall and fever.

She initially presented from her rehab facility after a fall. 
She
received a CTA torso which revealed multiple small pulmonary
emboli and possible acute diverticulitis. Patient also 
complained
of neck pain so there was some concern for possible meningeal
infection however patient refused LP. She also states that her
neck pain has been ongoing for the past several months and just
worsened over the past few days but in the same location and
general character. She has also had mild nausea with several
episodes of vomiting today. She has had right lower extremity in
___ and has been on anticoagulation but is currently not taking
any after multiple falls and decision by ___ to discontinue Eliquis due to concern for bleeding
complications from falls. She received vancomycin, acyclovir,
metronidazole, dose of Lovenox prior to transfer.

In the ED, initial vitals were:  99 87 ___ 91% RA.
 
- Exam notable for:  
Appears frail, no acute distress
Clear to auscultation bilaterally
No C, T, L-spine tenderness
No meningismus
Abdomen soft, nondistended, nontender
No CVA tenderness
Speech fluent, moving all extremities

- EKG: RBBB, left axis deviation. T wave inversion V1-V2,
flattening in V3-V4. Sinus rhythm.
- Labs notable for:  negative UA, flu negative at OSH.
- Imaging was notable for:  diverticulitis on OSH CT. CT-A with
multiple small pulmonary emboli.
- Patient was given:  IV Ciprofloxacin (400 mg ordered) .

Upon arrival to the floor, patient reports that she was living 
in
independent living and was taking care of her own finances and
medicines. She has had multiple falls recently and had to go to
rehab for physical therapy after her most recent hospital stay 
at
___.

She reports that this time she had pain in her right ankle and
was getting up from her commode when she fell. She denies 
hitting
her head. She reports that she pushed her life alert button 
which
is how they found her on the ground. She denied LOC. She denies
chest pain/palpitations/lightheadedness/SOB. She denied having a
fevers or chills leading up to this. Denies cough.

She reports that her neck pain started before her fall. She has
had that with a headache. She reports to me that the pain is on
the left but to my attending says that the pain is on the right
side of her neck. She is unable to move her head much due to the
neck pain.

She denies diarrhea/nausea and has actually had constipation for
the past 8 days for which she's been taking Colace. She denies
abdominal pain and dysuria. She refuses an LP understanding the
risks of refusing this procedure.

 
Past Medical History:
Right ___ DVT s/p IVC filter placed ___
Paroxysmal atrial fibrillation
Graves' disease Status post radioactive iodine
Hypothyroidism 
 hypertension

 ___ esophagus

cystitis

enterocolitis

Blepharitis
hypothermic 
severe degenerative joint disease

IMPRESSION:  
No evidence of deep venous thrombosis in the right or left lower

veins. 

 
Brief Hospital Course:
========
SUMMARY
========
Ms. ___ is an ___ year old woman w/ ___ DVT w/ IVC filter, 
paroxysmal atrial fibrillation, Grave's disease s/p radioactive 
iodine ablation, hypothyroidism, C diff colitis who presented as 
a transfer from ___ after a fall and fever. Initially 
there was concern for meningitis given fever and neck pain, 
however, patient without meningeal signs and refused LP. CTA 
chest was done which showed multiple subsegmental PEs in setting 
of being off anticoagulation since ___ and s/p IVC 
filter. Patient remained hemodynamically stable and started on 
Apixaban for anticoagulation.

#FALL: 
Has had frequent falls at rehab. All appear to be mechanical. No 
history of loss of consciousness but patient may not be a good 
historian. Has small pulmonary emboli which could have caused 
syncope but they are reportedly smaller PEs which make it less 
likely. She did not appear hypovolemic or to have had a seizure 
based on history. Trop were negative making cardiac ischemia 
unlikely. Held off on TTE as there was no evidence of murmur on 
exam. 

#SUBSEGMENTAL, SUBMASSIVE PULMONARY EMBOLISM: History of right 
lower extremity DVT s/p IVC filter. Discontinued Eliquis in the 
___ due to concern for bleeding in setting of multiple 
falls. Off anticoagulation, presented w/ multiple subsegmental 
PEs. Trop negative and BNP only mildly elevated. LENIs without 
evidence of DVTs. Vascular medicine consulted regarding 
anticoagulation management and felt that benefit of 
anticoagulation in prevention of further PE greatly outweighs 
risk of ICH from falls. Unclear why IVC filter was placed on 
___ but could certainly be propagating clots. Recommend 
removal of IVC filter in ___ months post discharge

#FEVER: No signs of pneumonia, UTI. Has neck pain but no signs 
of
meningitis on exam and she refused LP. Pain felt likely due to 
neck strain. She reportedly has evidence of diverticulosis on CT 
at OSH and was briefly treated with cipro/flagyl. Flu swab was 
negative and blood cultures so far showing no growth. Patient 
remained afebrile while hostpitalized. Suspect fever may have 
been due to PE. Discharged off antibiotics.

#WEIGHT LOSS: History of significant weight loss per patient 
over ___ year
period due to eating less. No early satiety, nausea, but has had 
decreased appetite. Patient appears otherwise AAOX3 and 
independent, which makes malignancy or systemic illness as cause 
of anorexia more concerning.

#NECK PAIN: most likely muscle strain but as above could be due
to meningitis in setting of fever. LP refused. Symptoms improved
with pain management as below. Treated symptoms with lidocaine 
patch, ibuprofen, Tylenol, and cyclobenzaprine with improvement 
in neck pain.

#ATRIAL FIBRILLATION: Continued propafenone. Apixaban was 
stopped in ___ due to multiple falls at home and risk of 
ICH. Consulted vascular medicine while hospitalized who felt 
benefit of preventing future PE and embolic stroke far 
outweighed risks of ICH from falls stating "Her CHADS-Vasc score 
is 3 (female, age) and her HASBLED score is 1 (Age). 
Furthermore, it is estimated in 1 model that a patient would 
have to fall 295 times in a year to average 1 ICH, the most
dangerous risk of A/C in patients who fall ___ M, 
___ G, ___ A, Laupacis A. Choosing antithrombotic therapy for 
elderly patients with atrial fibrillation who are at risk for 
falls. Arch Intern Med. ___ This risk is 
likely even lower with DoACs whose rate of ICH was lower than 
warfarin in trials. Therefore we would advocate continuing dose 
reduced Eliquis for Ms. ___ and interventions per the 
primary team for lifestyle and behavioral modifications to 
reduce falls." Patient was restarted on low dose apixaban.

#ANEMIA: normocytic anemia, stable from baseline

#HHYPOTHYROIDISM:
continued levothyroxine 88 mcg

#DEPRESSION: continue escitalopram 20 mg daily

#ARTHRITIS: ibuprofen and tylenol as needed

===================
Medication Changes
===================
- Started Apixaban 2.5mg BID
- Started Cyclobenzaprine TID:PRN neck pain (Please discontinue 
once neck pain improved)
- Started lidocaine patch QAM:PRN neck pain (Please discontinue 
once neck pain improved)
- Started multivitamin w/ minerals daily

===================
Transitional Issues
===================
[ ] History of multiple PE s/p IVC filter and on apixaban: 
Patient started on low dose apixaban during admission for a fib 
and history of PE. Unclear why IVC filter was placed and should 
be removed in 1 to 2 months post discharge.

[ ] Weight loss: Patient endorsed significant weight loss per 
patient over ___ year period due to eating less. Concern for 
malignancy as patient is otherwise functional. Please consider 
age appropriate cancer screening as outpatient if within 
patient's goals of care

[ ] History of falls: Likely mechanical falls based on history. 
Patient will be discharged to rehab but should have outpatient 
evaluation of lifestyle and behavioral modifications to reduce 
falls at nursing facility.

[ ] Anemia: Patient presented with anemia with normocytic anemia 
without evidence of acute bleeding. Given weight loss as 
described above, please consider further workup for GI 
malignancy if within patient's goals of care

Fever

Anemia
Atrial fibrillation

 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Ambulatory - Independent.

 
Discharge Instructions:
DISCHARGE INSTRUCTIONS

Dear Ms. ___,

You were admitted to the hospital because you had fevers and 
neck pain and concern for infection.

WHAT HAPPENED WHILE I WAS IN THE HOSPITAL?
- You had a CT scan of your lungs which showed multiple small 
blood clots and you were started on a blood thinning medication 
to prevent future clots
- Your neck pain was felt to be due to a pulled muscle and got 
better with pain medications and muscle relaxer.

WHAT SHOULD I DO WHEN I GO HOME?
- You should continue to take your medications as prescribed. It 
is especially important that you take your blood thinning 
medication called apixaban twice a day as prescribed. 
- Continue to work with the rehab on regaining your strength.
- You rehab center will make an appointment for you to see your 
primary care physician when you leave the hospital

It was a pleasure caring for you, and we wish you all the best.

Sincerely,
Your ___ team

 
Followup Instructions:
___

qafib.question: Does the note describe the patient as having permanent, paroxysmal, or persistent afib?

qprior_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having a stroke or transient ischemic attack?

qarterial_hypertension.question: Does the note describe the patient as having arterial hypertension on treatment (high bp e.g. >140, or HTN)?

qt2d.question: Does the note describe the patient as having Diabetes mellitus (DM1, DM2, T2D, T1DM, T2DM)?

qheart_failure.question: Does the note describe the patient as having heart failure?

qsurgical_valvular_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having valvular disease requiring surgery (stenosis)?

qafib_ablation.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a planned or past ablation procedure for afib?

qbleeding.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a serious bleeding in the past 6 months?

qpeptic_ulcer_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having peptic ulcer disease?

qrecent_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a stroke during this admission or within the last month? (Answer yes for any recent stroke if the date is unclear)

qhemorrhagic.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having any hemorrhagic tendencies or blood dyscrasias?

qbipolar.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with bipolar disorder?

qschizophrenia.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with schizophrenia or any schizoaffective disorders?

qmdd.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with depression or major depressive disorder (MDD)?

qmed_decisions.question: Does the note describe the patient as being unable to make medical decisions? (Answer no unless there is evidence the patient cannot make their own medical decisions).

qchads2.question: What is the highest CHADS2 score mentioned? Answer "NA" if no CHADS2 score is in the note.

qblood_glucose.question: What is the highest blood glucose lab mentioned? Answer "NA" if no blood glucose score is in the note.

qlvef.question: What is the lowest left ventricular ejection (LVEF, ef, ejection fraction) fraction mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no LVEF is in the note, Answer 55 if the lowest value is 55% or greater.

qPLT.question: What is the lowest platelet count (PLT) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no platelet count is available in the note.

qHGB.question: What is the lowest hemoglobin (HGB) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no HGB value is available in the note.

qCREAT.question: What is the higest serum creatinine (Creat) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no creatinine value is available in the note.

qAST.question: What is the higest aspartate aminotransferase level (AST) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no AST value is available in the note.

qBILI.question: What is the higest total bilirubin (TotBili, Bili) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no bilirubin value is available in the note.
